Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will be used to create Deck objects, which are groups of Cards.
    Author:
    AnneMarie Caballero

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Deck​()
      Constructs a default Deck object that holds 52 cards that are sorted.
      Deck​(boolean sorted)
      Constructs a Deck object that holds 52 cards.
      Deck​(Card[] hands)
      Constructs a Deck object with a Card[]

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Deck[] deal​(int numHands, int cardsPerHand)
      Deals a Deck
      boolean equals​(Deck other)
      Checks if this Deck is equal to the other Deck.
      Card[] getCards​()
      Returns the value of the Card[] that Deck holds
      int getTopCard​()
      Returns the index of the top card of the deck
      void mergeSort​()
      Uses the MergeSort method to sort the Cards in the Deck.
      Card pick​()
      Returns and removes a random Card from the Deck
      void selectionSort​()
      Uses the SelectionSort method to sort the Cards in the Deck
      void shuffle​()
      Shuffles the card array in the Deck
      java.lang.String toString​()
      Returns the String value of the Deck object

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck​()
        Constructs a default Deck object that holds 52 cards that are sorted.

      • Deck

        public Deck​(boolean sorted)
        Constructs a Deck object that holds 52 cards.
        Parameters:
        sorted - if true, sorts the Card[], if false, shuffles the Card[]

      • Deck

        public Deck​(Card[] hands)
        Constructs a Deck object with a Card[]
        Parameters:
        hands - sets the array of Card to the passed array

    • Method Detail

      • getCards

        public Card[] getCards​()
        Returns the value of the Card[] that Deck holds
        Returns:
        an array of cards that is the value of the cards in the Deck

      • getTopCard

        public int getTopCard​()
        Returns the index of the top card of the deck
        Returns:
        an integer representing the index of the top card of the deck

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle​()
        Shuffles the card array in the Deck

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Returns the String value of the Deck object
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of the Deck. If there is 52 cards, there will be four columns, else there will be one column.
        See Also:
        Object.toString()

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Deck other)
        Checks if this Deck is equal to the other Deck. Order matters in determining equality.
        Parameters:
        other - the Deck object that this is being checked against
        Returns:
        true, if this is equal to other; false, if this is not equal to other

      • deal

        public Deck[] deal​(int numHands,
                   int cardsPerHand)
        Deals a Deck
        Parameters:
        numHands - an integer that represents the number of hands to be dealt
        cardsPerHand - an integer that represents the card per hand that is dealt
        Returns:
        null, if there are not enough cards for the deal specified; an array of Decks that represents the hands dealt

      • pick

        public Card pick​()
        Returns and removes a random Card from the Deck
        Returns:
        a random Card from the Deck

      • selectionSort

        public void selectionSort​()
        Uses the SelectionSort method to sort the Cards in the Deck

      • mergeSort

        public void mergeSort​()
        Uses the MergeSort method to sort the Cards in the Deck. This method uses internal methods that were created using the pseudocode at this address: https://www.tutorialspoint.com/data_structures_algorithms/merge_sort_algorithm.htm
